question: 3 (a)
sols_html:
Let:

\[\begin{aligned} u = \sin(x), \quad du=\cos(x)dx\end{aligned}\]

Then the integral nicely simplifies to

\[\begin{aligned} \int \frac{\cos(x)dx}{\sin(x)} = \int \frac{du}{u} = \ln|u|= \ln|\sin(x)|\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Let:
:<math>
u = \sin(x), \quad du=\cos(x)dx
</math>

Then the integral nicely simplifies to
:<math>
\int \frac{\cos(x)dx}{\sin(x)} = \int \frac{du}{u} = \ln|u|= \ln|\sin(x)|
</math>
